subject: Running a precondition before all tests
msgSnippet: Hi guys, I m sure someone has already been through this, but as I wasn t able to find anything related in past messages, here we go: I have a precondition
messageBody:
Hi guys,

I'm sure someone has already been through this, but as I wasn't able
to find anything related in past messages, here we go:

I have a precondition before running all my tests. I need to run a
method that connect to a RMI registry and gets references to all
services.
As I need to accomplish this once before my tests, I'm satisfied on
running it on the setUp() method of a TestSetup. When I'm calling the
tests, I pass a suite to the TestSetup and everything works fine.
The problem is that I need to specify, through the command-line, if I
want to run a particular test or the whole suite of them. As I'm
using ant, it's something like this:

ant ---> runs the whole suite of tests
ant <nameoftestcase> ---> runs only a particular test case

Because of the precondition, I run into trouble. If I let the
precondition method into the TestSetup method, I lose it when I run a
single test case. If I put it on each TestCase code (on a superclass
for example) I'll have a lot of redundancy when I run the suite.
I've tried also to run the connection with the RMI before running
junit, as another Ant task, but it doesn't work. I don't know what
happens in this case, but it seems to me that another JVM is issued
and the tests can't access the references created by the connection
method.

Does anyone know what could I possibly do? Maybe another approach?
Thanks in advance,
Leonardo Barros
